solution_line_template: In the second month he can run {month2_distance} miles because {initial_run_distance} x {twice_factor} = <<{initial_run_distance}*{twice_factor}={month2_distance}>>{month2_distance}
In the third month he can run {month3_distance} miles because {month2_distance} x {twice_factor} = <<{month2_distance}*{twice_factor}={month3_distance}>>{month3_distance}
In fourth month he can run {month4_distance} miles because {month3_distance} x {twice_factor} = <<{month3_distance}*{twice_factor}={month4_distance}>>{month4_distance}
In fifth month he can run {month5_distance} miles because {month4_distance} x {twice_factor} = <<{month4_distance}*{twice_factor}={month5_distance}>>{month5_distance}
He needs to start training {months_needed} months ahead of time because {month4_distance} < {marathon_distance} and {month5_distance}>{marathon_distance}.
